resources.string: A low-carb, high-fat diet that helps you burn fat more effectively.
A diet inspired by the eating habits of Greece, Southern Italy, and Spain.
A diet based on the types of foods presumed to have been eaten by early humans.
A diet that excludes all animal products and focuses on plant-based foods.
A diet that excludes meat but may include dairy and eggs.
A diet that restricts carbohydrates, such as those found in sugary foods, pasta, and bread.
Dietary Approaches to Stop Hypertension, focuses on reducing sodium intake.
An eating pattern that cycles between periods of fasting and eating.
A 30-day diet that emphasizes whole foods and eliminates sugar, alcohol, grains, legumes, soy, and dairy.
A diet that balances macronutrients in a 40:30:30 ratio of carbs, protein, and fat.
A low-carb diet that emphasizes protein and fats.
A diet that emphasizes low-glycemic carbohydrates, unsaturated fats, and lean protein.
A semi-vegetarian diet that focuses on plant-based foods with occasional meat.
A diet that consists of unprocessed and uncooked foods.
A diet that includes fish and seafood but excludes other meats.
A diet that excludes gluten, a protein found in wheat, barley, and rye.
A diet that focuses on reducing inflammation through food choices.
A diet that restricts certain types of carbohydrates to reduce digestive symptoms.
A diet that combines the Mediterranean and DASH diets to improve brain health.
A diet that emphasizes whole grains, fatty fish, and root vegetables.
A diet that aims to balance the pH levels in the body through food choices.
A diet that consists entirely of animal products.
A diet that emphasizes whole grains, vegetables, and beans.
A diet that focuses on foods that activate sirtuins, a type of protein.
A diet that focuses on eating low-calorie, high-volume foods.
A diet that uses a points system to encourage healthy eating habits.
A diet that provides pre-packaged meals and snacks to control calorie intake.
A diet that uses meal replacement shakes and snacks to control calorie intake.
A diet that provides pre-packaged meals and one-on-one support.
A diet that uses meal replacements and lifestyle coaching to promote weight loss.
